quotes.quote: The sudden loss of her father was like living with a wound that would never heal, yet her memories of him were fading more and more every day.
The death of a parent is rarely expected and never accepted.
The death of my father is probably the biggest thing I ever faced. Daddy and I were best friends.
Upon the death of my father, our family and myself were emotionally and financially exhausted.
Who doesn't desire his father's death?
Those who have never had a father can at any rate never know the sweets of losing one. To most men the death of his father is a new lease of life.
Death is the liberator of him whom freedom cannot release, the physician of him whom medicine cannot cure, and the comforter of him whom time cannot console.
I love you every day. And now I will miss you every day.
Such a funny thing death is for mortals. You cry. You morn. You grieve. You get angry. But death is not always tragic, dear one. Sometimes death is the ultimate expression of love.
Death never pierces the heart so much as when it takes someone we love; cleaving the heart they held with their passing.
It doesn't matter who my father was; it matters who I remember he was.
When a great man dies, for years the light he leaves behind him, lies on the paths of men.
Death is the wish of some, the relief of many, and the end of all.
Death never takes the wise man by surprise, he is always ready to go.
Death is a commingling of eternity with time; in the death of a good man, eternity is seen looking through time.
Death is a challenge. It tells us not to waste time... It tells us to tell each other right now that we love each other.
Any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in Mankind; And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee.
It was very hard for all of us. It's still very hard. The anniversary of his death just passed, and every single one of his friends, still, after all these years... it's unbelievable.
Death not merely ends life, it also bestows upon it a silent completeness, snatched from the hazardous flux to which all things human are subject.
Death is the easiest of all things after it, and the hardest of all things before it.
Men sooner forget the death of their father than the loss of their patrimony.
Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.
Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.
I mean, death is a serious thing, certainly not to be sneezed at.
Death is a law, not a punishment.
Death ends a life, not a relationship.
The death of one man is a tragedy. The death of millions is a statistic.
Until the day of his death, no man can be sure of his courage.
Death solves all problems - no man, no problem.
I look upon death to be as necessary to our constitution as sleep. We shall rise refreshed in the morning.
The soul therefore cannot receive death, which is the opposite of this life, of which it is the source. And what do we call those beings that escape death?
There is no worse death than the end of hope.
Death gives Time all of its value.
Death is so much more vital than Time.
Another curious scientific phenomenon is the fact that the fingernails grow after death, as does the beard.
Men fear death, as children fear to go into the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased with tales, so is the other.
So he passed over and the trumpets sounded for him on the other side.
They say that an infant is born with a clenched fist, but a man dies with an open hand. Life has a way of prying loose our grasp on all that seems so important.
Nothing of God dies when a man of God dies.
We understand death for the first time when he puts his hand upon one whom we love
Death is but a path that must be trod / If man would ever pass to God.
The death of a natural father is traumatic.
Though not as dramatic as a violent death, the sudden death of a parent due to heart attack or stroke procedures many of the same responses in the survivors that violent deaths do.
When a family receives the death notification about a car crash, trauma can occur.
If your dad was killed in a car crash, chances are it made the news in some way.
We have a legitimate reason to be angry when a loved on e dies or leaves us. Death or abandonment disrupts our lives.
Even the most flexible of people do not like change that wasn't of their choice in the first place and over which they have no control.
Families engage in a conspiracy of silence around death. In their efforts to contain grief, the pain is actually intensified as people wall off parts of themselves.
Father absence and child understand the role your father's presence or absence and child development,' summarizes how a child's way of thinking often compounds the damage of father loss.
A family's style in dealing with emotions in general will have a great deal to do with how they deal with any loss, particularly the loss of someone important as a father.
Although some people may wish to avoid the feelings involved in the emotional or literal absence of their father, it is not possible to do so permanently without paying a price.

Try as they might, people cannot avoid dealing with father loss. If they attempt to avoid giving proper significance to this important relationship in their lives, they can expect to suffer the consequences in their lives.
Some boys, whose fathers were absent or emotionally damaged before their deaths, created an idealized father in order to defend against feelings associated with loss and abandonment.
The death of someone 'elderly' didn't seem nearly so tragic as if the deceased had been a younger man or woman.
A father's death brings another reality bite: Life is short no matter how long you live.
Death reduces all men to the same rank.
Death strips the rich of his millions and the poor man of his rags.
Although death is always terrifying, it is much easier for a teenage to cope with a parent's death than it is for younger children.
In general, adolescents will be able to get over a parent's death more easily because parents aren't the only people in their lives.
My father's life and death have molded every aspect of my life, for better and for worse.
Before my father's I had only witnessed death in disparate flashes, mostly through social media.
Sudden death creates a creeping sensation that you are living in an alternate reality.
For many men, the death of their father is the death of their cheering section.
Their dad was their guidance. His death means losing someone who gave affirmation and approval.
The death of a family member not only shakes your life to the core, but it also shakes your family structure.
